inn1.comm: fullish, angling into off stump, blocked into the covers
wide of the crease, this one comes in with the arm and hits the front pad as he looks to work it into the leg side. Easily missing leg stump

lovely delivery, and this one is plumb. Moor is stuck in the crease, and this one slides in with the arm again. This time, the line was straighter, and it struck him in line with middle stump and would probably have gone on to hit middle and leg
goes back to a length ball on middle stump, blocks into the off side
beautiful bowling. After all those flat arm balls, here's one that's a little slower and wider, straightens past the edge as Masakadza presses forward to defend
straighter and quicker, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
gone! Zimbabwe are two down! Back of a length, and this one leaves Chibhabha off the pitch. Goes for the punch away from the body, and only succeeds in nicking to the keeper
shortish on off and middle. Gets on his toes to defend into the leg side
length ball wide of off stump, flat-bats it hard, but can only hit it to point on the bounce
length ball close to off stump, a bit of curl away, and Mutumbami leaves it alone
a bit wider, a bit of away swing again, and Mutumbami leaves again
flat, round-arm ball sliding into middle and leg, defended off the front foot into the on side
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
first runs of the match, a touch shorter and Masakadza can go on the back foot and punch with the angle to long-on
another slider, and this keeps low. Mutumbami, stuck on the back foot, jams is bat down in a hurry to keep it out. It would have hit his off stump otherwise
wide of the crease again, a little slower on off stump, defended into the covers
flighted ball, wider of off stump, and it turns away and takes the outside edge as Mutumbami jabs away from his body. Ball rolls away wide of point
full outswinger on off stump. Mutumbami defends from the crease, into the off side, and is opened up a little by the swing
fullish, a bit of width outside off, driven towards cover point
beauty. Back of a length, straightens towards off stump. Mutumbami is squared up as he defends towards point
back of a length on off stump, punched to point
lovely delivery, angling in and swinging away late in the corridor to beat the edge of Mutumbami's defensive bat as he pushes half-forward to defend
fullish, a bit of width, no swing this time, and he lashes it away off the front foot between backward point and cover point
flighted ball wide of off, beats Masakadza's outside edge as he pushes forward to drive
beats him again. Lovely loop outside off and Maskadza drives away from his body and misses as it turns sharply away from him
a bit straighter, on off stump, and Masakadza brings his burly frame down low to reverse-sweep to the vacant third man boundary
flat, angling into off stump, gets a good stride forward to drive back towards the bowler
nicely flighted again, wide of off stump, this time Masakadza got close enough to the pitch to flat-bat it crisply through cover point
flat and full on middle stump, driven back to the bowler
shortish outside off, and Mutumbami's weight was on the front foot. He just throws his hands at it and slashes it away, in the air, to the left of third man
back of a length on middle and leg. Hits the batsman's thigh as he misses a flick
back of a length wide of off stump. No footwork from Mutumbami. Just stands there, lashes at it, and the swing beats his outside edge
length ball close to off stump, good leave from Mutumbami. Dawlat stands there in his follow-through, grins at the batsman with widened eyes
short, wide, and he can free his arms and lash that away over backward point
full, angling into leg stump, maybe straightens a touch to beat Mutumbami's attempted flick and hit his pad. Big appeal, not given, the umpire indicates there was a bit of bat on it
flighted ball on off stump, defended into the covers
lovely slow flight wide of off stump, drops on a good length. Masakadza leaves it this time
quicker on off stump, blocked into the covers
nice loop again, on off stump, angling in from wide of the crease. Looks for the drive, slices it squarer than intended, towards point
quicker, a touch shorter on off stump. Masakadza goes on the back foot and uses his wrists to force it down to long-on
length ball sliding in towards middle stump. Mutumbami is half forward, jams his bat down quickly to stop the ball from hitting his front pad
full on off stump, blocked down the ground towards mid-off
length ball swinging away outside off, beats Masakadza's no-footwork slash
full outside off, driven to backward point with an open face
fullish outside off, not quite driving length, and Masakadza is beaten, driving away from his body
length ball on middle and off, defended to mid-off
full on off stump, Masakadza drives without moving his feet and slices it away towards third man
slow flight outside off and he comes forward to defend with the turn, into the on side

flighted again, wide enough outside off for Masakadza to free his arms and launch that straight, over the bowler, a long way to the left of the long-on fielder, who's stationed fairly wide on the rope
quicker, flatter, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
flighted ball on off stump, Masakadza shows the full face and pushes to long-on
flighted ball close to off stump, whipped to long-on
full, close to off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball outside off, lots of outswing, left alone
length ball wide of off, swinging away, left alone
bouncer over off stump, Mutumbami ducks under it, keeping his eye on the ball
fullish, wide of off stump, chases it and slices it high in the air, square on the off side. Shenwari chases back from backward point, dives, and the ball is just out of his reach
full and wide, driven crisply but straight to short extra cover
tossed up nicely outside off. Masakadza is too early into his reverse sweep and the ball hits the back of his gloves
length ball outside off, blocked into the off side
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot to whip to long-on

slow flight outside off, big shout for caught behind after Mutumbami sweeps over the ball. Was there a bottom edge on it? The umpire thought long and hard, and finally raised his finger. There certainly seemed to be a sound as it passed his bat
down the track to the tossed-up ball on off stump, driven with the turn to long-on
flighted a bit wider, now Masakadza steps out to drive to long-on
full, close to off stump, driven to mid-off
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length wide of off stump. Masakadza takes a big, premeditated step across his stumps, punches it to mid-off
back of a length outside off. Masakadza steps across to whip to mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle stump, blocked to mid-on

bowled him! Chigumbura steps out of his crease, and he is nowhere near the pitch to play such an aggressive shot, looking to smash that through extra cover. It's just the perfect length, and it swings back in, beats the inside-edge, and knocks back off stump
flighted ball wide of off stump, presses forward and blocks into the covers
tossed up slow outside off, defended with the turn towards midwicket
length ball turning into middle stump, tucked away towards short fine leg
fullish on middle stump, clipped to the right of midwicket
flighted ball outside off, skips out and drives inside-out to long-off
flat length ball on off stump, whipped to midwicket
back of a length, a lot of inward movement, and that is such a tight leave. That didn't miss off stump by much at all
back of a length outside off, a bit of movement in, Raza inside-edges into his pad while defending off the back foot
fuller, again that big angle in, defended towards midwicket
full and wide and Raza gets a big stride forward to play a checked drive to cover point
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers

bowled him! Stuck on the crease, and Ashraf bowls a spectacular inducker, jags in from outside off and knocks back off stump as Raza tries to bring his bat down to defend. The length defeated him even more than the movement, I think
starts with a shortish ball wide of off, keeps low and skids under Masakadza's attempted cut
full-toss on off stump, flat-batted to short extra cover
flat length ball outside off, poked away through backward point, off the outside half of the bat
googly wide of off, beats the inside edge as he chases out to drive
very full, wide of off stump, Waller jabs it away to the third man boundary
another googly, turning in sharply from wide of off, beats Waller's attempted square cut
length ball outside off, aims a big drive at it and it runs down to third man off the outside edge
fullish, angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a bit slower and wider, driven to extra cover
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers
back of a length outside off, Waller flashes at it and edges thickly, just wide of the diving fielder at slip
tossed up outside off, defended to point with an open face
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish outside off, googly, chopped down to backward point
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full on middle stump, whipped to midwicket
googly, skids through incredibly low, at ankle height, as he goes back to cut. Big appeal as he's hit on his back foot, but that might have been missing leg stump
length ball on off stump, blocked to mid-off
length ball outside off, blocked towards point
length ball angling into off stump, denying him any room, blocked back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, presses forward to block to cover point

back of a length close to off stump, and that's a run out. What a way to lose a wicket in this situation. Punched towards point, and he sets off for a single. He's halfway down the pitch before Masakadza sends him back, rightly so. Hamza moves left from cover point, fields the ball on his natural side, throws to the keeper, who picks up the throw on the half-volley and has the bails off in a flash
very full on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, comes forward to defend and the ball rolls to backward point off the outside half of his bat
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
beauty. Lovely loop and dip outside off. Turns and bounces to beat the outside edge of his defensive poke
nice flight on middle stump, pushed to mid-on. Jongwe is a little late setting off for the single but it's easily completed in the end, with the fielder throwing off-balance
big googly, Jongwe doesn't pick it and pads up to it. Lots of turn and bounce, and maybe it was going over the stumps. Looked fairly close, though

gone, and that's a super catch by Nabi. Flighted ball outside off, turns away, and he can only outside edge as he drives away from his body. Goes quickly to the left of slip, and Nabi does brilliantly to dive and grab it in both hands
length ball on middle stump, pushed down the ground, towards mid-on
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump. Stays on the back foot and defends back to the bowler
length ball outside off, defended towards point
shortish googly turning into off stump, punched to mid-on
quicker one close to off stump. Stays in the crease and blocks into the covers
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball sliding on towards off stump. Goes on the back foot and punches to mid-on
another googly, skids through quick outside off, beats Cremer's attempted punch
flighted full-toss on off stump, pushed down to long-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length ball outside off, turns away to beat Masakadza's outside edge as he comes forward to defend
a touch shorter, goes back to whip to long-on
big appeal for lbw as this straightens to hit the front pad in front of leg stump as he props forward to defend. Might have pitched marginally outside leg
tossed up on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
wide of the crease, slider on middle stump, goes back and punches to long-on
full outside off, driven to long-off
a touch short close to off stump, punched off the back foot to long-on
flighted close to off stump, blocked into the cover point region
shortish outside off, flat-batted to long-on
googly, Masakadza misses the sweep and it beats him, turning in and sneaking below his bat
just a touch short, goes back to flat-bat to long-on and midwicket dives to his left to intercept
flighted ball on off stump, Cremer is a little early into his defensive prod, and it loops in the air before bouncing in front of the bowler
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
flighted and full on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
turn now, from leg stump. Masakadza opens up slightly, looking to play through the on side, and pops it into the covers off the leading edge
flighted outside off, slides on with the arm. Masakadza drags his attempted off-drive down to long-on
down the track, gets close to the pitch of the flighted ball wide of off and drives to long-off
loopy on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
flat and short wide of off, punched to cover. Came on too slowly for a more aggressive shot
tossed up on off stump, presses out and pushes with soft hands into the cover point region
googly, appeal for lbw as he beats the inside edge and his front pad as he comes forward to defend. Struck him outside the line, just
short ball on off stump, Cremer opens up and pulls dismissively, drills it through the gap between midwicket and deepish mid-on
loopy full-toss on off stump, driven down the ground towards mid-on
short ball, turns away to give Cremer more width, and he stands tall and lashes it away to the cover boundary
flighted ball wide of off stump, driven to long-off
a touch short outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length ball wide of off, pushes out to defend into the covers
flighted ball on middle stump, straightening a touch, defended back to the bowler
flatter, angling into the batsman, blocked into the on side
down the track, doesn't get to the pitch of the flighted ball, blocks it back to the bowler
down the track, again fails to reach the pitch of this one tossed up outside off, blocked into the covers
a bit quicker, goes back to punch to midwicket
nice flight, dips and turns towards middle stump, plays around his front pad to tuck it towards square leg
dragged short, pulled with the turn to deep square leg
length ball close to off stump, punched with the turn to midwicket

that's a run-out appeal at the non-striker's end and it's a big wicket if Masakadza is out of the crease! Rashid tossed it up, Cremer drove it back and it Rashid went to his right to deflect the ball to the stumps and replays show Masakadza dragged his bat back just in time
tossed up just outside off again and Cremer pushes it back gently
touch shorter and wider outside off, Cremer nudges it towards point for a quick single
a short googly and that's put away behind square for four! He rocked back early for the short ball it turned into him quite a bit and he pulled that wide of short fine leg in the gap
beaten this time! Tossed up nicely outside off to tempt a drive, the batsman gives in and misses!
thick edge and it falls well short of backward point! Masakadza went for a biggish shot this time outside off, the ball took a leading edge and went in the air but fell short
comes down the track and chips it towards long on for one
flatter and wider, Masakadza goes back to punch it to extra cover
still pretty wide and it's cut fiercely to be fielded at cover point this time
closer to the stumps on good length, flicked to deep midwicket for one
goes back and across for the slower ball, he waits and taps it softly towards midwicket for one more
much fuller outside off, Masakadza blocks it back off the front foot
full, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
fullish on middle stump, defended to mid-off
length ball on middle stump, defended to mid-on
again, on that middle stump line. Looks to use his wrists to work it into the leg side, can't beat midwicket
shortish, fourth-stump line, pulled to midwicket
length ball on off stump, a bit of inward nibble. Masakadza pulls his front pad out of the line and blocks into the covers
flighted ball wide of off stump, presses forward and blocks to backward point
ooh, that stopped on the batsman. Went back to punch a back-of-a-length ball with the turn, to long-on, and ended up spooning it in the air a little. Just out of reach of the diving midwicket fielder
there's that reverse-sweep. A bit of flight outside off, gives him the time and room to lap it away through fine third man
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
length ball outside off, shuffles across and works it through square leg
back of a length, turning in towards off stump, goes on the back foot and punches it back to the bowler
full, a bit of away swing outside off, jabbed into the covers
bouncer close to off stump, left alone. Good surprise delivery. Cremer wasn't expecting that. His feet didn't move at all. Just stood there and swayed away from the line
another bouncer, this time he hooks it for six. That's an amazing shot. He had to drag it from outside off, and he managed to middle it and send it sailing over the square leg boundary
shortish outside off, defended with soft hands towards backward point
short, angling into the body, gets on top of the bounce and uses his wrists to play it down to midwicket
yorker, a bit of late inswing towards middle stump, and Cremer does well to jab it back to the bowler
flat length ball on off stump, tucked away to midwicket
slowish, tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
loopy wide of off, stretches out to defend to backward point
this one doesn't turn. It was back of a length, outside off, and he went across to work it into the leg side. Popped it up into the off side off the leading edge
length ball on off stump, clipped to long-on
slowly tossed up outside off. Shahzad moved to his right when he saw Masakadza shape to reverse-sweep, but he couldn't get his gloves to it. Deflects off his pads to the third man boundary
back of a length outside off, beats the outside edge as Cremer opens his face, looking for the dab to third man
length ball outside off, opens his bat face and steers it to third man
fullish on off stump, shows the full face and defends towards midwicket
length ball outside off, punched to the left of cover to bring up his 30th ODI half-century
fullish, angling in, Cremer doesn't connect with the flick and is hit on the front pad, but it's sliding down leg. Ashraf aborts his appeal quickly
length ball on off stump, blocked to mid-off
tossed up outside off, driven to short cover
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
quickish legbreak outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, presses forward and pokes it into the covers
slider, goes straight through close to off stump. Presses forward to defend and it rolls towards mid-on off the inside edge
flighted and full outside off, pushed towards long-off with a straight bat
length ball outside off, can't beat short cover with his checked drive
length ball angling into off stump, uses his wrists to work it to midwicket
length ball angling into off stump, squeezed towards midwicket off the inside half of the bat
fullish outside off, pushed to mid-off
length ball wide of off stump and Masakadza pulls off a well-executed premeditated shot. Got across with his front leg and scooped it up and over short fine leg

length ball close to off stump, punched towards mid-off and he sets off for the single. Short extra cover comes diving in to interrupt, and Masakadza almost gives up, with so much distance to cover to the other end, but he can't quite release his underarm flick properly
short on off stump and that is launched out of Sharjah. It sits up, and Masakadza takes a big step back and swings freely, hitting under the ball to hit it away over wide long-on
slider on middle stump, defended into the leg side
shortish, close to off stump, pulled along the ground to long-on
flighted ball wide of off, driven to cover
short again, and this time Cremer pulls, too close to the man at deep midwicket to pick up more than one
nearly bowled by a dipping full-toss. Masakadza played outside the line of it, looking to drive through cover, and it just missed the base of off stump
now it's Hamza's turn to serve up a long-hop, and Cremer sits on his back foot, gets into a lovely stable position, and swats it away over wide long-on
full, sliding in towards leg stump, blocked back to the bowler
flighted ball outside off, a bit of turn. Cremer comes forward to play the checked drive, slices it to short third man
another slider, cramps Cremer for room as he goes back to punch. Squeezed out to point
quickish outside off, Cremer comes forward to reverse-lap to the left of short third man
wow. Lovely dipping length ball, not far from off stump, turns away to beat the outside edge
sees him coming down the track and flights it much wider outside off. Cremer stretches out and blocks into the point region
flighted on off stump, squeezed out to mid-off. Was looking to whip through the on side but it didn't turn
another long-hop, another pulled six, and this one takes Cremer to his maiden ODI half-century. Picked up the length in a flash there
tossed up on middle stump, clipped to long-on
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to the left of short fine leg
back of a length, turns in sharply to cramp Cremer, who tucks it quietly to midwicket
flighted on leg stump, swept towards backward square leg
quickish on off stump, goes on the back foot and blocks it back to the bowler
quickish googly, pitching middle and turning a long way down the leg side. Good take from Shahzad, moving nimbly to his left
another long-hop, and Cremer gets on the back foot quickly and pulls with great authority once again. This time it's a one-bounce four wide of long-on
loopy and full close to off stump, jabbed back to the bowler
googly, a touch short, can go back and watch it all the way, defends back to the bowler
loopy legbreak wide of offstump and Cremer plays it well, gets fully forward and uses his wrists to work it wide of midwicket
flighted ball on off stump, shuffles across and uses the angle to work it into the vacant midwicket region
tossed up outside off, driven back to the bowler. Went too hard at that, Masakadza
full on off stump, driven to long-off
comes down the track and Hamza fires it in full, hits him low on the pad. Too far down the pitch to give the lbw, and probably struck him outside the line too. Rolls away towards short third man
shortish outside off, chopped away to point
full on middle and off, jabbed back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs it softly into the short third man region
back of a length outside off, stabbed away to sweeper cover
full outside off, driven to mid-off
oh my. What a way to lose a wicket. It's a floaty full-toss outside off, and he goes after it and picks out the man at long-on
length ball on middle stump, pushed into the vacant mid-on region with a straight bat. That fielder is back at long-on, and mid-off sprints across to field it
full, angling in, catches Madziva on the shuffle and hits his front pad, but it's probably sliding down leg
full and flat, angling into off stump. Looks to drive through the off side, squeezes it into the short fine leg region off the inside edge
full on off stump, blocked to extra cover
flat length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
once again it's flat, angling into off stump, he gets a good stride forward and defends into the covers
hangs this in the air a little longer, flights it a bit wider, sliced towards backward point
that's plumb, beautifully bowled. Saw one a little shorter and shuffled across to work it into the leg side. Slid on, hurried through, and smacked his front pad right in front of the stumps
flighted and full on middle stump, driven hard back to the bowler, who stops it with his right foot
beauty. Dips on him outside off and spins past the edge of his defensive bat

short googly, turning into off and middle, pulled into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket. Great work from the fielder at long-on, sprinted quickly to his right and pulled it back just short of the rope
quickish on off stump, punched back to the bowler
and again, slowly tossed up outside off, gets it to dip and beat Masakadza's forward defensive
loopy googly wide of off, beats Masadza again as he slogs all around it
goes for the yorker, angled across the left-handed Chisoro, beats the inside-edge of his drive but the angle carries it past off stump
fullish outside off, blocked into the covers
length ball wide of off stump, lets it come on and taps it away to third man. Nicely played
outswinger wide of off stump and Masakadza chases it away from his body, looking to hit over the covers. Toe-ends it high, and it drops just short of Hamza running in from third man
length ball on middle and off, clipped to midwicket
full-toss, swinging down leg, looks to swipe it into the leg side and it runs off the outside of the pad into the fine leg region
flighted ball wide of off, gets on the front foot and dabs it softly into the point region
short googly, put down. Another bad ball nearly produces a wicket as Masakadza pulls straight to long-on. Nabi drops a simple waist-high catch.
googly, beautifully bowled. Angled across towards off stump and turns away further to beat the edge as he pushes at it away from his body
shortish outside off, chopped away through backward point
another googly, turning towards off stump. Chisoro goes back and across and defends into the on side
another googly, shortish, starts outside off and beats Chisoro as he stabs at it away from his body
yorker on off stump, jams down on it to keep it out
leg-stump yorker, looks to get his front leg out of the way and whip it through the leg side, can only inside-edge into his pad
slower ball angling down leg. Misses the sweep and it rolls off his pad towards the keeper
another superb yorker, middle-and-leg, dug out between the legs, rolls through square leg
shortish outside off, dabbed away to third man
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
flat and full close to off stump, driven back to the bowler
low full-toss outside off, makes a bit of room to slice it away but can't beat backward point
short, angling down leg, and Masakadza clears his front leg to swing it away over square leg, lands the ball on the stadium roof
full on off stump, clears his front leg for the big drive, hits it straight to long-off
turn and bounce outside off, beats the outside edge of Chisoro's forward defensive
low full-toss on middle and off, makes a bit of room to hit through the off-side, flat-bats straight to mid-off
wide yorker, reaches out and can't put bat to ball. Called wide as well
bouncer over middle stump, Masakadza sways out of the way. Shaped to pull initially, then realised he wouldn't be able to
another short ball, this one is shoulder high, angling into the batsman, and he goes for the pull and picks out the fielder at deep square leg

inn2.comm: shortish, wide, beats the bat as he chases away from his body. Ball kept slightly low there
very full, pings the pad as he misses the flick but that's definitely missing leg stump
back of a length, inward movement off the track, beat's Noor's inside edge as he looks to defend, doesn't miss off stump by much
bowled him! off-stump yorker, and it's straightened past his outside edge and taken out off stump. That's a sensational delivery
gone, he's on a hat-trick! Wide outswinger, Nabi went for the drive away from his body, and Mutumbami moves smartly to his right to take a good catch at shoulder height, with arms at full stretch
length ball, drifts onto the pads, clipped away towards long leg
length ball wide of off stump, left alone
beauty. Angles this in a little flatter, and Stanikzai isn't close to the pitch and reaches out with hard hands to defend. Outside edge runs away into the third man region
short and wide, gets across to cut but can't beat point
flat, angling into middle stump. Lets it come on and tucks it quietly to short fine leg
flighted ball wide of off stump, driven to cover
short, wide, and this time Stanikzai puts it away into the gap, skips back nimbly and cuts it past point
full outside off, enough width for Shahzad to get forward, head over the ball, and drive crisply past the diving extra cover fielder. Mid-off gives chase and pulls it back close to the rope
some extra bounce this time as Shehzad looks to cut without moving his feet, ball rises over his top edge
back of a length on off stump, defended into the on side with both feet in the air
full outside off and what a shot that is! All wrists and bottom hand, and he absolutely hammers that whip wide of mid-on
short, a bit of width, chopped down towards point
fuller, a bit wider, Shehzad has a big swing and doesn't connect. Umpire decides its too wide to be a legal delivery
short, a bit of width again, Shahzad times his cut well, and picks up two by the time third man races across to his right to stop it
short outside off, punched to backward point

down the leg side, and fine leg was in the circle. That would count as a bad ball on most occasions, but Stanikzai sweeps uppishly and straight to the fielder. A few feet either side of him and that would have been four
flat on off stump, goes back to a fairly full ball and blocks it back to the bowler
this one goes with the arm, across the left-hander, as he goes back to defend, and he slices it towards backward point off the outer half of his bat
full down the leg side and Shahzad executes his sweep better than Stanikzai did, playing it fine, to the right of the short fine leg fielder, and picking up a boundary
full-toss on leg stump, punched down the ground to long-on
short, wide, stands on his toes and cracks it away, rolls his wrists on top of the bounce and cuts fiercely to the left of backward point. Super shot
once again it's short and wide and this time third man can run around to his right and intercept Shahzad's cut with a tumbling stop
shortish outside off, punched into the covers
fullish close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler

length ball outside off and that is a stunning hit from Shahzad, just clears his front leg and swings across it to hit the wide long-on boundary on the full. Or has it hit it on the half-volley? Maybe the base of the boundary cushion. Six is the umpire's signal in the end
slower ball outside off, a little short, and Shahzad waits for it and swivels his body violently to pull it down to long-on
yorker on middle and leg, jabbed back to the bowler
short, a bit of width, makes a bit more room and cuts, but can't beat point
fullish on off stump, slides on with the arm, defended watchfully into the on side
full, sliding down leg, Shahzad misses the sweep
short, not too much width, and Shahzad does brilliantly, skips back while simultaneously making himself room, and opens his bat face to find the gap to the left of short third man. Superb placement

flighted ball on off stump, and Shahzad has thrown his wicket away. Looks like he wanted to hit it over mid-off and got too close to the pitch of the ball. Didn't get the elevation he wanted and Chigumbura dives forward to take a good low catch
full on off stump, whipped to mid-on with a lot of bottom hand
full, angling into the pads, clipped away through backward square leg
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers
fullish, angling away from off stump, left alone
back of a length, a bit wider, punched to cover point
full and very wide outside off, left alone
back of a length, closer to off stump this time, punched to cover
length ball sliding into middle and leg, goes back and tucks it through square leg
back of a length angling across, goes back and across and defends into the covers
full and flighted close to off stump, jabbed back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat. This one turned more than expected
not quite short enough for the back foot punch, manages to play it reasonably well, can't beat cover
fuller on middle, driven back to the bowler
back of a length, a touch too straight, tucked away to the left of midwicket
full, too wide outside off for Shahidi to be able to reach. He leaves it and the umpire signals wide
fullish, closer to off stump, driven to mid-off

got him! He's been angling them across right through these two overs, and this pitched in the perfect spot. Not too wide outside off, not full enough to drive, and Hashmatullah went at it with an angled bat and edged to Masakadza at wide slip
fullish, angling into off stump. No footwork from Shenwari as he looks to drive, and falls into the shot as he inside-edges into his pads
length ball close to off stump, this time his weight moves nicely into a forward defensive push into the covers
too straight, clipped nicely off the pads towards long leg

got him, another catch for that wide slip fielder. This time it's the right-handed batsman, Ashraf. Back of a length outside off, straightens just a touch. Ashraf punches at it, away from his body, and the thick edge falls right into Masakadza's lap
lovely delivery, straightens in the corridor after bringing Shenwari half-forward, beats his defensive bat
shortish, wide of off stump, left alone
shortish outside off, uses his wrists to try and manouevre that past backward point but it's a little too close to the fielder
back of a length outside off, jumps across and pokes it away to third man

and another! This is beautifully bowled, another one straightens outside off. Shafiqullah pokes with hard hands, away from his body, and Mutumbami dives at full stretch to his right to take a super low catch in one glove
length ball angling into middle stump, tucked away through square leg
length ball outside off, poked away to third man with an open face

full outside off, not full enough to drive, and Jongwe has another wicket! Seams away with some extra bounce, and Shenwari walks into a drive and edges to the keeper. Once again, his front-foot movement is a touch too late
good first ball to the lower-order batsman, full and straight, and pings him on the front pad as he stands there with no footwork. Big appeal, but it's angling down leg
fullish outside off, blocked towards cover point
length ball on off and middle, blocked back to the bowler
length ball wide of off stump, left alone
fullish outside off, steered to third man with an open bat face
full on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball wide of off stump, left alone
length ball outside off, Dawlat plays and misses, looking to defend, and then shadow-practices a flourishing leave
he gets an opportunity to try out the leave, as Madziva sends down a length ball wide of off stump
back of a length outside off, defended into the covers
short, wide, and he's cut that straight to cover point. It was there to be hit, he hit it well, but didn't keep it down, and Waller barely had to move to complete the catch
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fullish outside off and he flows into a crisp checked drive, straight to cover point
is that the win? No, it isn't. Full, angling into off stump, hits the front pad as he comes forward and across to drive. Impact was just outside off
length ball wide of off, Hamza chases and misses
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump, and Dawlat brings his bat down at the very last moment to defend to mid-on
back of a length wide of off, left alone
full outside off, stretches out and defends towards backward point
edged, falls short of slip. Length ball outside off, no footwork as he pokes at it, and the edge dies just short of Masakadza
bouncer, he didn't know too much about it. Ducked into it, and it lobbed up behind the wicket off his shoulder
full outside off, driven to mid-off, and Namibia's record is safe
fullish on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
length ball outside off, no footwork from Dawlat and he plays and misses
length ball wide of off, Dawlat leaves again, and it carries at over head height to the keeper
full on middle and off, and Dawlat is squared up looking to work it into the leg side. Ball runs away to third man off the back of his bat
full, angling into off stump, defended solidly into the covers
shortish, angling into off stump. Hamza rides the bounce well and defends with soft hands towards point
flattish length ball turning from leg to off, defended with soft hands, bottom hand nowhere near the handle
this one slides straight on as he presses forward to defend, misses the bat by a long way and strikes the front pad low down. In front of middle stump. I have no idea how that was not given out.
now he flights it and Dawlat goes after it, opening his shoulders as he swings through the line, and hits it straight down the ground, one bounce for four
length ball on middle stump, goes on the back foot and punches to long-off
wow. Drifts in towards off stump and spins like it had the combined revs of Shane Warne and Stuart MacGill's biggest legbreaks, beats the outside edge by a mile
length ball sliding into the pad, tucked away through square leg

back of a length down the leg side, and it's all over. Jongwe finishes with a five-for as Hamza, looking to glance it off his hips, gets a little tickle through to Mutumbami, who takes another excellent catch, diving to his left this time
